pages.title: Mining Tools
pages.text: Three mining strategies, from simple to complex:$(br2)$(bold)1. Mine Ores$() — Scan nearby for visible ores and mine them. Good for exposed caves or mountains.$(br)$(thing)"Mine some iron"$(br2)$(bold)2. Strip Mine$() — Dig a tunnel at the optimal Y-level. Finds ores in walls as it goes. Quick and targeted.$(br)$(thing)"Strip mine for diamonds"$(br2)$(bold)3. Create Mine$() — Build a permanent mine with shaft, hub room, and branch tunnels. Maximum coverage.$(br)$(thing)"Create a diamond mine"

pages.title: Ore Y-Levels (1.21)
pages.text: Optimal Y-levels for each ore:$(br2)$(li)$(bold)Coal$(): Y=96 (Any pick)$(li)$(bold)Copper$(): Y=48 (Any pick)$(li)$(bold)Iron$(): Y=16 (Stone pick+)$(li)$(bold)Lapis$(): Y=0 (Stone pick+)$(li)$(bold)Gold$(): Y=-16 (Iron pick+)$(li)$(bold)Redstone$(): Y=-59 (Iron pick+)$(li)$(bold)Diamond$(): Y=-59 (Iron pick+)$(li)$(bold)Emerald$(): Y=232 (Iron pick+, Mountains)$(br2)The companion automatically goes to the best Y-level and auto-crafts the required pickaxe tier.
